comment.author: 61849735@N00
comment._content: Looks like men and women together fighting for the vote for women.  Good idea!

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
They are gathered on the roof of a building (Suffrage headquarters) for the photo. Here is a companion shot:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4100331517/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 24231207@N07
comment._content: Frances Maule Bjorkman was a New Yorker prominent in the Suffrage movement. R.C. Beadle was the Secretary of the Men's League for Woman Suffrage of the State of New York.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Robert Cameron Beadle and Alfred H Brown. See NYT of August 26, 1913 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9F06E0DB163DE633A... "Alfred H. Brown, a seasoned campaigner and lecturer, departed from the headquarters of the Woman's Political Union, at 13 West Forty-second Street, yesterday afternoon at 5 o'clock for the first tour of New York State made by a man in the cause of woman suffrage."

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: Thanks.  We'll correct and add to the data next time we update the record.
